titleStmt.title: The returne of the renowned caualiero Pasquill of England, from the other side the seas, and his meeting with Marforius at London vpon the Royall Exchange VVhere they encounter with a little houshold talke of Martin and Martinisme, discouering the scabbe that is bredde in England: and conferring together about the speedie dispersing of the golden legende of the liues of the saints.
titleStmt.author: Pasquill, of England, Cavaliero.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A09142 of text S114218 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 19457). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 69 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 16 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: The returne of the renowned caualiero Pasquill of England, from the other side the seas, and his meeting with Marforius at London vpon the Royall Exchange VVhere they encounter with a little houshold talke of Martin and Martinisme, discouering the scabbe that is bredde in England: and conferring together about the speedie dispersing of the golden legende of the liues of the saints.
titleStmt.author: Pasquill, of England, Cavaliero.
Nash, Thomas, 1567-1601, attributed name.

publicationStmt.publisher: If my breath be so hote that I burne my mouth, suppose I was printed by Pepper Allie [i.e. printed by John Charlewood],

notesStmt.note: The imprint is fictitious; printed in London by John Charlewood (STC).
Running title reads: Pasquill and Marforius.
In this edition, B4r line 31 reads "hee should".
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
